intro: Galium aleppicum, commonly known as Aleppo bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender stems that are often reddish in color and are covered with fine hairs. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium aleppicum is native to regions of Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
